required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 30, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: COVID-19 Study of the Serological Response Against the Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS) Coronavirus 2 (CoV-2) Virus in 2 Types of Employees, Hospital and Non-hospital, at Institute Curie
clinical_study.official_title: COVID-19 Study of the Serological Response Against the SARS-CoV-2 Virus in 2 Types of Employees, Hospital and Non-hospital, at Institute Curie

brief_summary.textblock:
This research proposes to study a large healthy population active for the presence of antibodies directed against the Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome Coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) virus and this over time.
After verification of the inclusion criteria and information by the coordinating investigative doctor, the volunteers sign a written consent. A nurse will take blood samples under safe conditions compatible with the pandemic period and while respecting the protection of the volunteer's personal data.
The blood samples will be taken at 4 times: T0 (day of inclusion), 1 month, 3 months and 6 months' post-inclusion.
Each blood sample consists of a collection of 5 mL of blood in a dry tube. The serum samples will be extracted and collected prospectively from the blood samples. A questionnaire will be completed by the inclusion volunteer (T0) in the study then 1, 3 and 6 months' post-inclusion.

primary_outcome.measure: Antibodies against the SARS-CoV-2 virus in serum at inclusion
primary_outcome.description: Detection of antibodies against the SARS-CoV-2 virus with serological tests

primary_outcome.measure: Antibodies against the SARS-CoV-2 virus in serum at 1 month
primary_outcome.description: Detection of antibodies against the SARS-CoV-2 virus with serological tests

primary_outcome.measure: Antibodies against the SARS-CoV-2 virus in serum at 3 months
primary_outcome.description: Detection of antibodies against the SARS-CoV-2 virus with serological tests

primary_outcome.measure: Antibodies against the SARS-CoV-2 virus in serum at 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Detection of antibodies against the SARS-CoV-2 virus with serological tests

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparative performance of anti-SARS-CoV-2 antibody detection techniques
secondary_outcome.description: Comparative performance of anti-SARS-CoV-2 antibody detection techniques (sensitivity and specificity of serological tests)

secondary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of immune subjects for SARS-CoV-2
secondary_outcome.description: Prevalence of immune subjects for SARS-CoV-2 in a well-defined active healthy population, working at the hospital or not, leading to variable exposure levels

secondary_outcome.measure: Nature and quantity of anti-SARS-CoV-2 antibodies
secondary_outcome.description: Nature and quantity of anti-SARS-CoV-2 antibodies: ImmunoglobulinM, ImmunoglobulinG and ImmunoglobulinA)

secondary_outcome.measure: Evolution of the different antibodies against the SARS-CoV-2 virus over time.
secondary_outcome.description: The analysis of the evolution of serology results over time will be done by a mixed model taking into account the repeated framework of the data of a subject

clinical_study.condition: Volunteers From the Institute Curie Staff Who Are Not Showing Active SARS-CoV-2 Infection

arm_group.arm_group_label: Subjects who are not showing active SARS-Cov2 infection

intervention.intervention_name: Blood samples (collection of 5 mL of blood in a dry tube)
intervention.description: A nurse will take blood samples under safe conditions compatible with the pandemic period and while respecting the protection of the volunteer's personal data. The blood samples will be taken at 3 times: T0 (day of inclusion), 3 months and 6 months' post-inclusion. Each blood sample consists of a collection of 5 mL of blood in a dry tube. The serum samples will be extracted and collected prospectively from the blood samples. For each blood sample, a sample number will be assigned by the laboratory management system of the Department of Biology at Institut Curie.
intervention.arm_group_label: Subjects who are not showing active SARS-Cov2 infection

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Person, adult volunteer outside of any acute infectious episode with SARS-CoV-2* (see paragraph indication), working at the Institute Curie and able to exercise their professional activity on one of the 3 sites of the Institute Curie: "Paris, Orsay or Saint Cloud".
- Person aged 18 or over.
- Information and consent of the person to the procedures related to the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Declaration by the subject of signs suggestive of Coronavirus Infectious Disease 2019 (COVID-19) infection with SARS-CoV-2 in progress or for which the end of symptoms dates from less than 7 days
- Inability to submit to study monitoring for geographic, social or psychological reasons
